DataElement.preferredName: Population Density County Of Residence Census Tract Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of individuals in the county of residence based on the patients primary residence zip code using the U.S. Bureau of the Census tracts for purposes of population enumeration (updated last on 4/28/20).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Population Density County Of Residence Census Tract
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The number of individuals per unit geographic area._A region created by territorial division for the purpose of local government._Any address at which a person dwells more than temporarily._Relatively permanent statistical subdivisions of a county used by the U.S. Bureau of the Census for purposes of population enumeration. Each tract has a unique identification number consisting of a 4-digit basic number and a 2-digit suffix of the form 1234.56.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The number of individuals per unit geographic area.

Concepts.definition: The number of individuals per unit geographic area.

Concepts.definition: A region created by territorial division for the purpose of local government.
Any address at which a person dwells more than temporarily.

Relatively permanent statistical subdivisions of a county used by the U.S. Bureau of the Census for purposes of population enumeration. Each tract has a unique identification number consisting of a 4-digit basic number and a 2-digit suffix of the form 1234.56.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: all components of an address, including building number, street name and type, city, state, postal code, and country.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number of individuals per unit geographic area._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A delineated geographic area encompassing residential, commercial, and other non-residential urban land uses with a residential population of at least 2,500 but fewer than 50,000 people.

Concepts.definition: A delineated geographic area encompassing residential, commercial, and other non-residential urban land uses with a residential population of at least 2,500 but fewer than 50,000 people.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-urbanized geographic area. “Rural” encompasses densely settled small towns with a residential population of less than 2,500 people, more sparsely populated areas, and remote areas.

Concepts.definition: A non-urbanized geographic area. "Rural" encompasses densely settled small towns with a residential population of less than 2,500 people, more sparsely populated areas, and remote areas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A delineated geographic area encompassing residential, commercial, and other non-residential urban land uses with a residential population of 50,000 or more people and a density of 1,000 people or more per square mile.

Concepts.definition: A delineated geographic area encompassing residential, commercial, and other non-residential urban land uses with a residential population of 50,000 or more people and a density of 1,000 people or more per square mile.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Urban and urban clusters vs p
ReferenceDocuments.description: Urban and urban clusters vs population not in the first two categories

ReferenceDocuments.name: HTAN-Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: The density of population in the county of residence, based on census data (updated last  on 4/28/20):  Use patient zip code to find the county the patient lives in by going to https://www.unitedstateszipcodes.org/ - enter the zip code in the main text field and use the associated county on the right side of the result field. Go to https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs/data/covid_19/Data_Profiles_for_HHS/050-County_By_State/.  Select the dp02_XX.csv file where XX = the two letter abbreviation for the appropriate state. On row 166 find the total population for the appropriate county.  If the total population is <2,500 enter a value of "Rural Population"; if 2,500 - 50,000 enter a value of "Urban Cluster"; or if >50,000 enter "Urban Population".

DataElement.changeDescription: 4/1/21 jk added urban cluster PV/new terms; upd RS.  3/29/21 jk chg RS to incomplete, waiting on term for urban cluster. 3/8/21 jk created for HTAN Diversity data value; waiting on term for urban cluster.
